text: Mount Kinabalu is a high mountain on the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia. This is in Malaysia. The mountain is protected as a park, named Kinabalu Park. The park was awarded the country's first World Heritage Site. Because of over 5,000 plant species, it is also one of the worldâ€™s most important biological sites. At its peak, the indigenous Kadazan people make their homes there. The mountain's name comes from the name "Akinabalu" (meaning Revered Place of the Dead). == References == == Other websites == Category:World Heritage Sites in Asia Category:Mountains of Asia Category:Geography of Malaysia Category:Borneo
title: Mount Kinabalu
